answers.answer: Also id like to add yesterday was Halloween so i was walking all night and sweating wearing a thong. Idk if this irritated it more.

You have a fungal infection by the sounds of things.When you wash do not use soaps, shower gels or feminine sprays.  These will cause dryness and also change the pH level of your skin.You can see your doctor who can take a swab, or by your symptoms may prescribe an antifungal cream and/or give you a prescription for a one dose oral capsule.You can buy these over the counter from the pharmacy.  The cream that you require is called Canesten and the oral one dose capsule is called Fluconazole.  The Fluconazole costs around £10 in the UK.   The doctor can prescribe stronger creams on prescription if the Cansten does not work.As a home remedy, apply natural live set yogurt to your sore area after washing with water and gently drying.Your boyfriend may also need to be treated even if he does not have any symptoms.  Your doctor will be able to advise you on this.If you are overweight, losing some weight will help with regard to the sweating between the legs.  Only wear cotton underwear and use a non biological washing detergent.  If you suffer from diabetes or glucose intolerance, make sure that this is well controlled.  If you have a diet that consists of a lot of sugar, cutting down will help too.If you are experiencing itching frequently down below, it may be worth your doctor to take a blood test to check your sugar levels.Best wishes.

question: Wednesday i had unprotected sex with my boyfriend. Later that day i realized i was a little irritated just thought it was nothing serious. It is now Friday and my vaginal area is red and itchy and feels very irritated. It has been like this since thursday morning. What could it be? Im about to start my period and my vaginal area always gets a little burning feeling right before but this seem so much worse. Any ideas ??
title: What do you think?
